dt: {bc}to control, regulate, or keep in order by use of police
{bc}to perform the functions of a police force in or over
{bc}to supervise the operation, execution, or administration of to prevent or detect and prosecute violations of rules and regulations
{bc}to exercise such supervision over the {a_link|policies} and activities of
{bc}to make clean and put in order

et: in sense 5 borrowed from Middle French {it}policier{/it} "to administer, govern, control," derivative of {it}police{/it} "administrative organization"; in other senses verbal derivative of {et_link|police:1|police:1}
shortdef: to control, regulate, or keep in order by use of police
to perform the functions of a police force in or over
to supervise the operation, execution, or administration of to prevent or detect and prosecute violations of rules and regulations

dt: {bc}the act or action of supervising the activities or policies of one's own group in order to prevent or detect and address violations of rules and regulations without outside enforcement

dt.t: But there is no easy answer, other than rigorous {wi}self-policing{/wi} by users.
Not all march organizers agree that {wi}self-policing{/wi} is necessary or, even, appropriate.

shortdef: the act or action of supervising the activities or policies of one's own group in order to prevent or detect and address violations of rules and regulations without outside enforcement
having, involving, or engaging in self-policing
